| NumTypeNumeric
data RCharacter = RCharacter {
rcVals :: [String]
rcNames :: Maybe [String]
rcIdent :: String
rcScope :: Scope
}
data RBoolean = RBoolean {
rbVals :: [Bool]
rbNames :: Maybe [String]
rbIdent :: String
rbScope :: Scope
}
data RVector
= VNumeric RNumeric
| VCharacter RCharacter
| VBool RBoolean
data RList = RList {
rlCols :: [RObject]
rlNames :: Maybe [String]
rlScope :: Scope
rlIdent :: String
}
data RObject
= OList RList
| OBoolean RBoolean
| OCharacter RCharacter
| ONumeric RNumeric

data Scope

Data structures for describing the AST.

Valid range for a lexically scoped variable. TODO: This really should be implemented using a frame stack.

data RNumeric
All numeric data types in R are actually represented as doubles; all R atomic datatypes are actually vectors.
